nodes.bodyText: Why do you replace kafka instead of put CC directly into first deploy?
Already discussed, I have reworked it. Now i using the shared kafka where i firstly remove the CC and the add him...

So we have a java client that is set up to query the state endpoint. Obviously we don;t want to pull the whole cluster-operator module into system-test but would it make sense to move the client into operator-common so that you could use it here?
WDYT @ppatierno and @kyguy?
@tomncooper +1 We can update right after as the java client gets into master
Well it may not be worth it for one method but if it turns out we need it for more tests we could move it to operator-common

The difference between using curl and our Java API client is that the returned JSON could be different.
For example, related to the user tasks endpoint, the client manipulate the original JSON got from the HTTP request in order to produce a simplified one for the specific usage of the operator. Maybe we should avoid this manipulation and moving the logic to extract right information at the operator level? I am not sure that using a client which doesn't return the raw JSON is the right thing to do for the STs.

So, do you suggest to use the curl utility for all API calls? In that case, we will not be verifying the API itself on the system level, which invokes me another question. It is good approach to use the curl and not API?

This is a good question. My feeling is that we should leave it there (and document that it will be there) because the user might want to reactive CC at a later date. The user can always delete it manually later.
So the topic should stay, unless @ppatierno or @kyguy object?
@tomncooper +1
I agree. Is that useful leaving the topic there for a sort of historical analysys of the metrics? Not sure if it's something that CC supports.
Good. ))
How is this handled for Kafka? Obviously, we don't want to update the CR with all the default values. CC prints all configs to its log at startup so you could head the log and grep for the setting?
@see-quick can you elaborate a little bit more I am not sure I got what you mean.

So the problem here is that whenever I want to customize the settings of the cruise control, for instance, change the broker capacity I am unable to do it because I will get the NPE. Is it desired? Because how can I change the properties of the Cruise Control?

Ah my bad, you are talking about creating a CruiseControl object with the default fields! I had the same problem with this when writing the unit tests and should have made this code more testable back then. Anyways, to get around this, can you do something like:
CruiseControlSpec cruiseControlSpec = new CruiseControlSpec()
cruiseControlSpec.setConfig(CruiseControlConfiguration.getCruiseControlDefaultPropertiesMap());

Or can CruiseControlConfiguration.getCruiseControlDefaultPropertiesMap()) not be accessed from system test classes?
As above, you could grep the CC log.
is this only way to grep the log @tomncooper . I do not like this solution is there any alternative? If no, I will use this log but in general logs in the containers are not so reliable.
There are no default settings for CC specified in the Kafka CR, but you could add/override CC settings in the Kafka CR and check that they match the generated CC properties file in the container
Is this just a formatting change or was this an accident?
Good catch....accident
It is more specifically the state endpoint
As far as I remember the state endpoint return the status of various services running or not on CC. Maybe just checking that Running exists is not enough to test that CC is working properly.
Some suggestion what is needed to verify?

So the load monitor state can be one of the following options:
public enum LoadMonitorTaskRunnerState {
  NOT_STARTED, RUNNING, PAUSED, SAMPLING, BOOTSTRAPPING, TRAINING, LOADING
}

Any of which (except maybe NOT_STARTED) show that CC is running. Are we just trying to verify that CC is up and running correctly? Basically if you get a JSON return from the State endpoint then CC is up. However if you want to check it is actually working you should probably check for the load monitor doing someting other than NOT_STARTED or PAUSED?
If you want to check functionality of an active rebalance you can check the ExecutorState which can have the following values:
  public enum State {
    NO_TASK_IN_PROGRESS,
    STARTING_EXECUTION,
    INTER_BROKER_REPLICA_MOVEMENT_TASK_IN_PROGRESS,
    INTRA_BROKER_REPLICA_MOVEMENT_TASK_IN_PROGRESS,
    LEADER_MOVEMENT_TASK_IN_PROGRESS,
    STOPPING_EXECUTION
  }
How can I invoke the situation where LoadMonitor will be in the state for instance in PAUSED. It would be great if I have some reproduction procedure. @tomncooper
I don't know how you would get the load monitor to pause. It is not documented anywhere. But from reading the code it is a possible state.
So instead of looking for just RUNNING. Look for any of RUNNING, SAMPLING, BOOTSTRAPPING, TRAINING, LOADING as these are all states that indicate that the load monitor is doing useful valid work.

Would be feasible to test that the metrics reporter is not configured anymore in the new Kafka brokers because we removed CC? We could check the Kafka pod log or maybe better the configmap containing the updated broker configuration? Wdyt @kyguy @tomncooper
That is a good idea, either or should work fine!
As opposite to the previous comment, could we verify that the metrics reporter is configured on Kafka?
You should be careful with this timeout. The REST API default timeout is 10seconds so you may timeout the tests before you get a response of any kind from the server.
So do you suggesting to make this GLOBAL_CRUISE_CONTROL_TIMEOUT little bit bigger? Would be suitable 30s ?
Well anything larger that 10secs, to be safe 20 should do.
This is check after CC deletion or some recovery usecase?
Seems that I have no longer using this method because firstly i though that i will test that scenario with CC after he is deleted. But CC let the topics inside Kafka even CC is deleted. :)
I will remove it :)
Shouldn't we use some constants instead of this magic numbers?
Add acceptance tag for this one will be useful
